Bilateral myringotomies and insertion of.context: Bilateral myringotomies and insertion of Shepard grommet draining tubes.

Bilateral myringotomies.context: 1. Bilateral myringotomies. 2. Insertion of Shepard grommet draining tubes.

Insertion of Shepard grommet draining tu.context: 1. Bilateral myringotomies. 2. Insertion of Shepard grommet draining tubes.

persistent recurrent infections.context: The patient had a long history of persistent recurrent infections and was placed on antibiotics for the same.

antibiotics.context: The patient had a long history of persistent recurrent infections and was placed on antibiotics for the same.

thick mucoid material.context: Middle ear spaces were suctioned of small amount of thick mucoid material on both sides and then Shepard grommet draining tubes were inserted on either side.

inflamed middle ear mucosa.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

active acute infection.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

foul cerumen.context: With the patient under adequate general anesthesia with the mask delivery of anesthesia, he had his ear canals cleaned utilizing an operating microscope and all foul cerumen had been removed from both sides.

Bilateral inferior radial myringotomies.context: Bilateral inferior radial myringotomies were performed, first on the right and then on the left.

Shepard grommet draining tubes.context: Middle ear spaces were suctioned of small amount of thick mucoid material on both sides and then Shepard grommet draining tubes were inserted on either side.

Floxin drops.context: Floxin drops were then instilled bilaterally to decrease any clotting within the tubes, and then cotton ball was placed in the external meatus bilaterally.
